verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of David<WH1732>, to bring to remembrance<WH2142>. O LORD<WH3068>, rebuke<WH3198> me not in thy wrath<WH7110>: neither chasten<WH3256> me in thy hot displeasure<WH2534>.
For thine arrows<WH2671> stick fast<WH5181> in me, and thy hand<WH3027> presseth me sore<WH5181>.

There is no soundness<WH4974> in my flesh<WH1320> because<WH6440> of thine anger<WH2195>; neither is there any rest<WH7965> in my bones<WH6106> because<WH6440> of my sin<WH2403>. rest: Heb. peace, or, health
For mine iniquities<WH5771> are gone over<WH5674> mine head<WH7218>: as an heavy<WH3515> burden<WH4853> they are too heavy<WH3513> for me.
My wounds<WH2250> stink<WH887> and are corrupt<WH4743> because<WH6440> of my foolishness<WH200>.
I am troubled<WH5753>; I am bowed down<WH7817> greatly<WH3966>; I go<WH1980> mourning<WH6937> all the day<WH3117> long. troubled: Heb. wried
For my loins<WH3689> are filled<WH4390> with a loathsome<WH7033> disease: and there is no soundness<WH4974> in my flesh<WH1320>.
I am feeble<WH6313> and sore<WH3966> broken<WH1794>: I have roared<WH7580> by reason of the disquietness<WH5100> of my heart<WH3820>.
Lord<WH136>, all my desire<WH8378> is before thee; and my groaning<WH585> is not hid<WH5641> from thee.
My heart<WH3820> panteth<WH5503>, my strength<WH3581> faileth<WH5800> me: as for the light<WH216> of mine eyes<WH5869>, it<WH1992> also is gone<WH369> from me. is gone: Heb. is not with me
My lovers<WH157> and my friends<WH7453> stand<WH5975> aloof from<WH5048> my sore<WH5061>; and my kinsmen<WH7138> stand<WH5975> afar off<WH7350>. sore: Heb. stroke my kinsmen: or, my neighbours

They also that seek<WH1245> after my life<WH5315> lay snares<WH5367> for me: and they that seek<WH1875> my hurt<WH7451> speak<WH1696> mischievous things<WH1942>, and imagine<WH1897> deceits<WH4820> all the day<WH3117> long.
But I, as a deaf<WH2795> man, heard<WH8085> not; and I was as a dumb man<WH483> that openeth<WH6605> not his mouth<WH6310>.
Thus I was as a man<WH376> that heareth<WH8085> not, and in whose mouth<WH6310> are no reproofs<WH8433>.
For in thee, O LORD<WH3068>, do I hope<WH3176>: thou wilt hear<WH6030>, O Lord<WH136> my God<WH430>. in: or, thee do I wait for hear: or, answer
For I said<WH559>, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice<WH8055> over me: when my foot<WH7272> slippeth<WH4131>, they magnify<WH1431> themselves against me.
For I am ready<WH3559> to halt<WH6761>, and my sorrow<WH4341> is continually<WH8548> before me. to halt: Heb. for halting
For I will declare<WH5046> mine iniquity<WH5771>; I will be sorry<WH1672> for my sin<WH2403>.
But mine enemies<WH341> are lively<WH2416>, and they are strong<WH6105>: and they that hate<WH8130> me wrongfully<WH8267> are multiplied<WH7231>. are lively: Heb. being living, are strong
They also that render<WH7999> evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896> are mine adversaries<WH7853>; because I follow<WH7291> the thing that good<WH2896> is.
Forsake<WH5800> me not, O LORD<WH3068>: O my God<WH430>, be not far<WH7368> from me.
Make haste<WH2363> to help<WH5833> me, O Lord<WH136> my salvation<WH8668>. to: Heb. for my help
